value.name: Projects Dashboard WSL Launch Fix
observations: Problem: Projects dashboard in WSL couldn't launch individual projects in new terminal windows
Root cause 1: gnome-terminal not available in WSL2, tried to use Linux terminal commands
Root cause 2: Nested quote escaping issues when calling Windows cmd.exe from WSL bash
Root cause 3: Rolldown native bindings mismatch - node_modules installed in WSL has Linux bindings, but Windows CMD needs Windows bindings
Root cause 4: Windows 'start' command returns immediately causing SIGTERM, which was treated as an error
Solution: Create temporary batch file that runs 'wsl bash -c' to execute dev server in WSL environment
Fix applied: Ignore SIGTERM signal as it's expected behavior when 'start' command launches new window
Implementation: Batch file approach eliminates quote escaping complexity
Final solution tested and working: Dashboard at localhost:5180 successfully launches projects
No errors in server logs after implementing SIGTERM handling
Batch file cleanup working correctly (removes .bat files after 5 seconds)
Browser auto-opens after 4 second delay as expected
Solution is production-ready and handles WSL environment correctly
Additional issue discovered: Node.js not found in non-interactive shell
Root cause 5: wsl bash -c uses non-interactive shell which doesn't load NVM or PATH
Final solution: Changed to wsl bash -l -c (login shell) to load user environment
Login shell loads ~/.bashrc and ~/.profile which set up NVM
Final batch file command: wsl bash -l -c "cd 'path' && npm run dev"
Issue fully resolved: Projects now launch successfully with all dependencies available
Critical issue discovered: Windows PATH pollution in WSL environment
Root cause 6: Windows npm from nvm4w (/mnt/c/nvm4w/nodejs/npm) was being used instead of WSL npm
Windows npm can't find node.exe when running in WSL context
ULTIMATE FIX: Use explicit full path to WSL npm: /home/kg/.nvm/versions/node/v22.20.0/bin/npm
Final working batch file: wsl bash -c "cd 'path' && /home/kg/.nvm/versions/node/v22.20.0/bin/npm run dev"
Removed -l flag since explicit path bypasses PATH issues entirely
Solution is production-ready and immune to Windows/WSL PATH conflicts
Testing confirmed: Projects now launch successfully without node not found errors

value.name: WSL Development Environment
observations: Kayla uses WSL2 on Windows for development
Rolldown (Rust-based Vite bundler) requires matching native bindings for platform
Critical: Always execute npm/pnpm commands through WSL to use correct bindings
Dashboard runs on localhost:5180, backend on localhost:3001
